title: The Art Of Writing Randian Monologues
summary:
Key ideas
- Ayn Rand’s book The Art of Fiction has advice on how to determine the proper length for characters’ philosophical speeches.
- Abstract principles can only be stated in fiction if they are concretized in the problems and actions of the story.
- The length of a philosophical speech depends on how detailed and complex are the events offered to concretize the speech.

Key learnings
- The abstract discussion in fiction should be natural in the context and almost unnoticeable.
- The action of the story should support the broad philosophy presented to avoid being perceived as propaganda.
- The length of a philosophical speech depends on how detailed and complex are the events to concretize the speech.

Key questions 
- How can characters go outside without abruptness or boredom when writing fiction?
- What are some good books on fiction-writing, preferably by beloved authors?
